main event: A witness observed a bright light in the sky moving erratically over Boise, Idaho on July 7, 1968.
interesting points: The object was traveling at an extremely high rate of speed and making very sharp, right-angle turns that the witness believed no conventional aircraft could make.
The object was silvery in color and giving off a very bright, almost blinding light.
The object suddenly disappeared from view, as if it had been turned off or accelerated to a speed beyond the witness's ability to see it.
The witness reported the sighting to the authorities but does not know if they were able to provide any answers.
The report mentions that a weather balloon was released around the time of the sighting, but the object's movements did not match that of a balloon.
sighted object: a bright, silvery light moving erratically in the sky
